text: Hi all, we're looking into making it easier to track conversions on HubSpot Forms (and Lead Flows) via Google Analytics/Tag Manager. We'd love to get a sense for the best way to offer this up in-app/via the direct embed that would work best for you all. Can you share a few ideas and existing implementations you have? (cc <@U8ZE2AMJ4>)
We are working it. We hope to have a solution Production this week.
you can view the iframe url, but you'll be losing the live update feature.

New Design Manager - anyone know if it’s possible to enter a custom URL for linked files in a custom module?

For example we often use CDN’s for certain scripts - fonts, slider libraries, modal libraries etc.
You mean in the CSS / JS windows?
I mean when in the custom module editing screen. I want to link such files the proper HubSpot way instead of putting script tags or <link> ’s in my module.
I've used 3rd party hosted resources within the `{{ require_css }}` and `{{ require_js }}` functions with no issues
those are supposed to be banned in the new design manager though. That’s how we used to do this in the past. In  the new design manager however those are not supposed to function.
that's news to me
oh, i see what you mean... from within custom modules the linked files doesn't allow for 3rd party resources

<http://designers.HubSpot.com/transitioning-from-v1-to-v2-modules>

<http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/reference#restricted-hubl>

It appears their documentation referring to the requires is not consistent

yes, that’s what I mean.

I prefer to use that because HubSpot places the JS in the footer and the CSS in the header that way, and we don’t have to worry about the HuBL requires breaking
:thinking_face:

Hi guys – using this code to add an arrow following the submit button on the form. Only issue is the arrow wants to drop down to its own line. Any ideas on how to make this display directly after the submit text? Screenshot coming.
Arrow falls onto its own line instead of displaying inline.
display: inline-block; on the after?
Yea... That was my thought too, doesn't seem to do it though.
`.hs_submit * { display: inline-block;}`
:point_up_2: quick hack that should work. There are divs inside of the hs_submit div which is most likely the issue
or you could use the after on the `.actions` class and then you only have to deal with the input
Which part is inconsistent?

The function of linked files is to make sure that all of a modules’s assets are bundled in with the module so it’s easy to copy modules around. If there are references to other assets in the module, we can’t guarantee those links will continue to work.
<@U7V9DQ31P> that did it! Thanks.
right - require_js and require_css are intended to be used from within templates, just not from within custom modules

<@U22PJPGK0> So - require_JS and require_css is only intended to work in the content settings and in template head(there are no hubl modules anymore)

And if you want to use CDN URL’s in a module… don’t. is what I’m getting from that
You can also use require_js and require_css in templates, but yes

Just wondering... Is there a reason that there are only 10 items displayed at a time in file manager?  I can't be the only one who would like to be able to browse the entire file structure on one page.
agreed, when you have alot files, 10/page is annoying. At least giving an option of `10 | 25 | 50 | All` would be nice
it measures the height of your browser screen i believe.
there's always FTP
I tend to use FTP when I need to do anything intensive, I just don't get the logic behind it
<@U38EZFVFE> I think it's just limited to 10.  Just tried on all three of my monitors
The new file manager as well?
good question
I'm also limited to 10. My url shows file-manager-beta so I assume I'm seeing the new one.
yeah. That sucks.
<@U8RN3623Y> Should be able to fix this
It is limited to 10. I assume it was a design constraint. It predates me. I can ask about it in the morning and open an issue for it.
